metadata.synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.
metadata.how_to_trigger:
loadlevel WLD_Main_A 

goto -64.39, 37.44, 607.51 

Destroy the Blocked Door (Ctrl Shift K) 

Go up the stairs and open door (god mode help a lot to avoid dying from fire)

roll amazing

Save HalfElve under the pillar 

excort him outside the building

The corps of his love is → goto -85 601

To get the Dowry:

CTRL + Left click on character

SetCharacterOsirisFlag PLA_StuckHalfElf_State_HasDowry

15.speaker: Benryn
15.context: NodeContext: Speaking to his dead wife's body.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Can you tell me what she looks like?

63.speaker: Benryn
63.text: I have to keep looking. Miri!

59.speaker: Benryn
59.text: Miri, no... gods, no, no, no!
59.context: NodeContext: Speaking to his dead wife's body.

112.speaker: Benryn
112.text: You should've stayed... you should've been with me.
112.context: NodeContext: Speaking to his dead wife's body.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: How did you two get separated?
67.context: NodeContext: He's explaining a stupid argument he and his wife had that led to her storming outside, where she was killed by goblins.

42.speaker: Benryn
42.text: I was in our room. We had a fight.
42.context: NodeContext: He's explaining a stupid argument he and his wife had that led to her storming outside, where she was killed by goblins.

45.speaker: Benryn
45.text: If I'd just kept my mouth shut about that bloody dowry, she'd... she'd still be here.
45.context: NodeContext: He's explaining a stupid argument he and his wife had that led to her storming outside, where she was killed by goblins.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: About that dowry - pretty sure I found it.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Extends hand - 'Give it to me'.NodeContext: Player retrieved the dowry. He's surprised, but not suspicious. He's asking the players to hand it over.

58.speaker: Benryn
58.text: You did? Please - she'd want her sister to have it.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Extends hand - 'Give it to me'.NodeContext: Player retrieved the dowry. He's surprised, but not suspicious. He's asking the players to hand it over.

25.speaker: Benryn
25.text: Maybe I judged you too quickly. Thank you.

80.speaker: Benryn
80.text: I'd need some time alone with her... to say goodbye.

81.speaker: Benryn
81.text: I know this doesn't change anything, but it helps. Thank you.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm keeping it. Consider it payment for saving your life.

77.speaker: Benryn
77.text: Fine. I hope you choke on it.
77.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

76.speaker: Benryn
76.text: What's a few coins? The sister won't miss them.
76.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: What's a few coins? The sister won't miss them.
62.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

39.speaker: Benryn
39.text: He can afford it - he's got one less mouth to feed now.
39.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: He can afford it - he's got one less mouth to feed now.
110.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

22.speaker: Benryn
22.text: You took the gold? I was rather hoping for the body...
22.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: You took the gold? I was rather hoping for the body...
55.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

70.speaker: Benryn
70.text: Allow me to apologise on Lae'zel's behalf, sir. Her lack of tact is a burden to us all.
70.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Allow me to apologise on Lae'zel's behalf, sir. Her lack of tact is a burden to us all.
21.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

119.speaker: Gale
119.text: Allow me to apologise on Shadowheart's behalf, sir. Her lack of tact is a burden to us all.
119.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: Allow me to apologise on Astarion's behalf, sir. His lack of tact is a burden to us all.
37.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

56.speaker: Benryn
56.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

90.speaker: Karlach
90.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

101.speaker: Benryn
101.text: By the hells' fires, has your heart shrunk so small?
101.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but not too mad

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: By the hells' fires, has your heart shrunk so small?
47.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but not too mad

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: That was a rather unimpressive display of pettiness, if you ask me.
53.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but not too mad

86.speaker: Karlach
86.text: I ought to smack some manners into you, you know that?
86.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but not too mad

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Sorry, but I don't have it anymore.
84.context: NodeContext: Starts angry, but collects himself quickly.

102.speaker: Benryn
102.text: Then get it back! I'm sorry, it's just... it's important.
102.context: NodeContext: Starts angry, but collects himself quickly.

32.speaker: Benryn
32.text: Please, it'd mean so much to her.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: About that dowry - I know where it is.

48.speaker: Benryn
48.text: You do? Please, can you return it to me? She'd want her sister to have it.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: What was that about a dowry?

95.speaker: Benryn
95.text: It's for her sister's wedding. I made a stupid joke about keeping it.

111.speaker: Benryn
111.text: We argued about it for hours. Then she took the dowry and left.

41.speaker: Benryn
41.text: She said I'd never see her again. She was right.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I think I found the dowry.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: This isn't on you. There was no way you could have known.

121.speaker: Benryn
121.text: I'm sorry, Miri. I'm so sorry.

31.speaker: Benryn
31.text: Please, just go. I need a moment with her.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Count your blessings. At least you're still alive.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: She was trying to get back to you.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to Mirileth's corpse.NodeContext: Talking to his dead wife.

88.speaker: Benryn
88.text: No. No! Why didn't you run? Why didn't you hide?
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to Mirileth's corpse.NodeContext: Talking to his dead wife.

103.speaker: Benryn
103.text: This is all my fault. We were arguing. She ran off.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: It wouldn't have made a difference.
40.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

83.speaker: Benryn
83.text: She would've survived! If only I'd kept my mouth shut about that bloody dowry...

13.speaker: Benryn
13.text: What am I going to do? She's all I had.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You'll be all right, with time.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I can pray for her, if you like.
10.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

91.speaker: Benryn
91.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I pray to thee, Gond - guide Miri to peace in death.
72.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

97.speaker: Benryn
97.text: Thank you. She would've like that.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Pray to your own god instead.
14.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

69.speaker: Benryn
69.text: That's... thank you. I hope your god listens.
69.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

94.speaker: Benryn
94.text: The gods won't listen to me. It's my fault she's dead.
94.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

38.speaker: Benryn
38.text: Her body's not even cold and you're questioning her faith?

93.speaker: Benryn
93.context: NodeContext: The player was a jerk to him about his dead wife. He's pissed.

100.speaker: Benryn
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks around at the wreckage and the bodies.NodeContext: Initially in shock, before the thought of his wife breaks him out of it.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Didn't you say something about a dowry?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I found this chest - I think it's yours.

104.speaker: Benryn
104.text: I won't forget what you did for me. For her. Thank you.
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks around at the wreckage and the bodies.NodeContext: Initially in shock, before the thought of his wife breaks him out of it.

116.speaker: Benryn
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks around at the wreckage and the bodies.NodeContext: Initially in shock, before the thought of his wife breaks him out of it.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Miri? Who are you looking for?
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds his hand about the same height as himself.

43.speaker: Benryn
43.text: My wife. She was outside when the goblins came.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds his hand about the same height as himself.

120.speaker: Benryn
120.text: She was wearing a green blouse. Brown hair, about this tall.
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds his hand about the same height as himself.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Sorry, I haven't. But I can look for her.

4.speaker: Benryn
4.text: Thank you. She can't have gone far.

114.speaker: Benryn
114.text: No. No, it can't be. I need to see.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Save your breath. There aren't any survivors.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: She's dead. I found her body in one of the burned buildings.
